lead_paragraph: Government warplanes attacked the towns of Maarat al-Noaman and Kafr Nabl a day after the main Syrian opposition group said it would no longer participate in talks in Geneva.

byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, and Maher Samaan from Paris.

headline.print_headline: Cease-Fire in Syria Crumbles as Government Airstrikes Kill Dozens in Northwestern Town
headline.main: Syria Cease-Fire Crumbles as Bombings Kill Dozens

snippet: Government warplanes attacked the towns of Maarat al-Noaman and Kafr Nabl a day after the main Syrian opposition group said it would no longer participate in talks in Geneva.
abstract: Syrian government warplanes attack town of Maarat al-Noaman, site of anti-government protests and home to some Islamic extremists; attack kills dozens of people and confirms failure of fragile cease-fire.
